claim(uint256,address,uint256,bytes32[]).details: Claim tokens with a merkle proof.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setMerkleRoot(bytes32).details: Sets the merkle root for the contract after deployment of the contract.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

claim(uint256,address,uint256,bytes32[]).notice: it needs to be made sure that the contract holds enough tokens to be claimed.the merkle root must be set before calling this function.

setMerkleRoot(bytes32).notice: setting a merkle root is irreversible. It's an one time operation. In case of a mistake, another MerkleDistributor contract will need to be deployed. Make sure that the inheriting contract has a method to recover tokens to the owner.
